text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Central | native_name = | native_name_lang = tsn | type = District | image_skyline = BotswanaSeroweWaterhole.jpg | image_alt = | image_caption = Waterhole in Serowe | nickname = | motto = | image_map = Botswana - Central.svg | map_alt = | map_caption = Location within Botswana | mapsize = frameless | coordinates = | coordinates_footnotes = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | established_title = | established_date = | founder = | named_for = | seat_type = Capital | seat = Serowe | government_footnotes = | leader_party = | leader_title = | leader_name = | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 147730 | area_note = | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 638604 | population_as_of = 2011 census | population_density_km2 = auto | population_demonym = | population_note = | timezone1 = Central Africa Time | utc_offset1 = +2 | postal_code_type = | postal_code = | area_code_type = | area_code = | website = | footnotes = }} Central is a district in Botswana. The capital city is Serowe. It is the largest district and has the most people of any other district in Botswana. Some important tourist attractions are: Francistown, Selebi-Phikwe, Solomon's Wall, Moremi Gorge, and Mashatu Game Reserve. The six sub-districts of Central are: Bobonong, Boteti, Mahalapye, Orapa, Serowe Palapye and Tutume. ==Notable people== *former President Sir Seretse Khama *former President Festus Mogae *former President Lt. General Seretse Ian Khama ==References== Category:Districts of Botswana
title: Central District (Botswana)
